snippet: With 11 armored-car heists this year, the Texas city accounts for about a third of the national total. One company, hit four times, took the unusual step of publicly calling out “the bad guys.”
abstract: Armored car company GardaWorld, in response to series of robberies in Houston, has publicly declared that it intends to defend itself from thieves, either through legal or physical means; city has experienced 11 armored-car heists in 2013, about third of national total.
lead_paragraph: With 11 armored-car heists this year, the Texas city accounts for about a third of the national total. One company, hit four times, took the unusual step of publicly calling out “the bad guys.”

headline.main: In Houston, Armored Cars Are Doing the Opposite of Dissuading Robbers
headline.print_headline: In Houston, Armored Cars Are Doing the Opposite of Dissuading Robbers
